Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ariston hotel this april 2010, the staff is rude, unhelpfull. we made our reservation 5 months in advance, when we arrived they gave us a room with a view of the service stairs, in a far cornerthe room was terrible, the bed was uncomfortable. the worst part is the service the hotel manager is definately in the wrong job he has no people skills whatsoever. they started construction work at 7am, and did not clean up after finishing, and they never told us about it when we checked in. since we did it through expedia they told us they could not do anything to right their wrongs. do not stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: minnemandy
Reviews.Content: Super contemporary decor in the room was very hip and fun. Nothing but a good experience did we have at this hotel. Great location near the train station and easy access to public transport around the city too. Loved it and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A nice relaxing stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: azrt
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a big group we spent few days in Rome at hotel Ariston. Our stay there was very nice they do have big well furnished rooms all with a modern stile and decor. Hotel staff very friendly and always willing to help. We had a great time at the hotel bar where they have a wide screen showing always same events at our time we will be watching the olympic sky games . Dinners there were all very good and always different.If i will be back to Rome in the future i will book it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are too small & the bathroom room is 2.5 metres by 1 metre.”
Reviews.Author: MicheleMalta
Reviews.Content: Paying more than 100 euros for a small room with a tiny bathroom is absolutely a robbery. In the bathroom, water comes out from everywhere and if you are more than 90 kg. forget about the shower because the cubicle is too narrow for you. Mosaic pieces come out during your showering. Breakfast is good and so is the reception area. Location is excellent if travelling by train.

Reviews.Title: “Be back with family”
Reviews.Author: EDH1967
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something close to Termini station, since I arrived by train from Florence, and the next day I had to go to the airport. I have chosen this hotel and I have to say after all the bad stories I have heard about hotels in this area of Rome, Ariston had exceeded all my expectations! The warm and professional welcome, the efficient and super-fast check-in was really what I needed after a long day of work and then hours on the train... My executive room was superb! Thank you! I will be back definitely, for sure with my family!

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Carlos456
Reviews.Content: For a Romantic holiday, where else but Rome?? Me and my boyfriend had a wonderful stay in this amazing city and fortunatly were lucky enough to end up in this hotel. Having planned our trip last minute we chose Hotel Ariston for its discounts and availability. I've heard that this sort of manouvering works out for the worst but I guess luck was by our side; the hotel was clean, cozy, and modern, an enjoyable change after walking around the busy streets of Rome all day. Our room was quite big and bright, great atmosphere. The breakfast was a yummy mix of traditional italian "cornetti" and so on, and your typical breakfast items from home. The hotel staff were very very nice, and made sure we saw the best in the best of ways (ex. cheap but excellent tours, typical resturants).. just like getting advice from local friend. Great stuff

Reviews.Title: “Very Unsafe hotel, just want to warn other travellers”
Reviews.Author: Gulabo
Reviews.Content: I went to Italy on my last holiday travel in Dec 2009 with my husband & 2 young children. The trip was combined with Mediterranean cruise which we thoroughly enjoyed & had a great time. After cruise we disembarked at the port & arrived to Rome Termini station by train & then walked to the hotel with all our baggage in the drizzling rain. No taxi was ready to go since the Hotel Ariston was very close to the stattion. Once arriving at Ariston hotel lobby we relaxed & checked in showing our passports. After that we returned the PP to the bag which was placed nearest to us and that the last we saw of it. It got stolen right from the hotel lobby. Hotel staff was very uncooperative & till date they are not ready to show us their surveillance camera. During our 3 days stay there, we had bad experience there. Not suitable to call it a 4 star hotel by any standards. Service is too bad. Shower does not work. Bed is creeking. Rooms were not made up until 3pm. We totally feel that Ariston hotel staff was involved in the theft & it is a syndicate. When they have installed CCTV cameras then why they are not opening it or showing it to us. We presented them with Police report which they asked for & gave them all details but they refuse to take any responsibility or help us in anyway. We gave them a claim letter to claim it from their insurance company since the theft took place in their hotel lobby but they have not taken any action so far. I just would like to warn all the travellers to beware & extra alert when they are travelling to Rome & staying in any hotel. Heard that even things go missing from the hotel room itself. Only my toothbrush went missing after first morning but that is the least. Our major loss was that bag carrying 4 original passports of the whole family & Camera which had all the photos of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Professional staff and nice room”
Reviews.Author: fetther
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a business trip in Rome. We've been booked at the Ariston hotel by our company 'cause we had a meeting there. Rooms were nice, spacious and clean. Meeting facilities were perfect and and the coffee break was good. The Hotel is centrally located, just few steps away from the main railway station and metro stops. Everybody there is professional and friendly. After work, we could easily reach the Colosseum and all the main sites in Rome. We stayed there just for 3 days, but I will reurn there with my family on next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location easy to move in town!”
Reviews.Author: omart5
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the hotel ariston during a bussiness trip and i find it very convenient .The location is good ,very close to termini station was easy to reah the airport by train.Internet connection was good as well as breakfast.It has a very nice bar to have a drink in the evening .I did book it directley on the hotel website and i found a last minute offer with a good discount.I would suggest to use the hotel wbsite to do your booking there and save some money they do have a lot of different offers.I will be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Negative experience”
Reviews.Author: Fedjuska
Reviews.Content: "Superior" gloomy room (it was impossible to distinguish day from night as the window overlooked a narrow inner courtyard), the bar-fridge was empty, tv channels reception very bad. Poor bathroom furniture, with shower, toilet and a microscopic shelf . I don't dare to think how an "ECONOMY" room looks like

Reviews.Title: “Thouroughly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: J01970
Reviews.Content: Having spent a couple of horrible nights in an apparently 5 star hotel The Ariston was recommended to us by a local. At half the price of the previous hotel, it was a most welcome surprise to find this clean, modern, funky and friendly hotel. It is across the road from Termini and as with previous posts it may not be the location of choice, but at only a 15 minute walk through Cavour to the Colloseum and with the metro practically on your doorstop - you can get anywhere in Rome within minutes - there were no complaints from us.

Reviews.Title: “Box-sized room, narrow hallway to you room, tiny bathroom....”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetBunny
Reviews.Content: On our last day, because of some errors made by Orbitz.Com, the Hotel Morgana's manager sent us over to Ariston Hotel, which apparently is owned by the same owner. So, if you had read my reviews about Hotel Morgana, you wouldn't be surprised with the rooms in Ariston Hotel. Yet, honestly, I think the receptionist at the Ariston is a tad friendlier than Hotel Morgana. She was helpful. But here are what's bad about it: The room is literally like a box, once we put in our carry-ons, we have no room to walk. It was even smaller than those apartments in Tokyo, Japan. Just TINY.....The TV was a 13 in one. The queen sized bed is really a combined of 2 twin beds and the mattresses are horrible. You could feel the springs are poking you throughout the night. The shower room, although with a nice glass door, is very tiny for even a 5'3" and 110 lbs person -- me. I actually bumped to the wall a few times a got myself a nice bruise as a souvenir. The location is again, the only reason we didn't just walk out, it's 5 minutes walk from the Termini, it's one blocks down and about 3 blocks left. It has a nicely decorated lounge with nobody in there. And the wifi is 8 euro for 24 hours. Our 99 Euro deal from Orbitz this time did include breakfast, but we had to leave by 630am to catch our train to the airport, and they don't serve breakfast till 7am. All in all, it's just as bad as Hotel Morgana. They both are worse than Motel 6!! And I would never recommend this place to anyone. I don't even mention it in my traveling blog.....

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, incompetent management. Fraud!”
Reviews.Author: DrAlf
Reviews.Content: I purchased a hotel stay with breakfast and when I checked in I was told breakfast was an extra charge. Lots of thefts in the area have occurred so the hotel manager and the security chief decided to take matters into their own hands. After staying in the hotel for 4 nights the hotel staff still could not identify me and decided to treat me -the customer- like a thief by mugging me 1.5 blocks away from the hotel, grabbing me by my belongings (back-pack) and forcing me back to the hotel... These are the very people who are supposed to show you hospitality! The hotel location is the only plus. I am sure one can find better customer care and hospitality at a youth hostel. Stay Away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tori_luke
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ariston for one night whilst passing through Rome. The city itself is fantastic and can not reccomend it enough. Hotel very good. Rooms spacious and clean, good aircon and bathroom. Very functional but nice. Check in went ok but check out was a bit of an issue. Booked via the web and was quoted a price of £81. Came to pay on check out and the reception tried to charge us E94. I pointed out the terrible exchange rate but the man on the desk could not care less. Paid in pounds rather than euros eventually but still ended up being £2 more, I have no idea why and said man was not in a hurry to explain. This did put a bit of a downer on what was otherwise an enjoyable stay. So overall hotel is ok but I would definately pay before you stay if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. But you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Luiggi
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend in Rome with friends and I had a great time there staying at the Ariston. Before booking I think it is important to be aware of the range of rates they offer. According to the reviews on Tripadvisor, the experience of staying on the unrenovated first and second floor or staying on the renovated 4th floor can be like staying on different hotels. We booked a triple executive room on the 4th floor and the first impression was a bit dissapointing as they gave us two proper double beds and the third was a single extra added bed. We thought it wasn´t what we paid for and complained to reception, they ended up saying that there is no really such triple room in the hotel and that this room could host up to 5 according to the layout, erm...well, I think that is too many people in a room but... It happened that the extra bed was quite comfy and the room was spacious so I didn't mind having it. The general feeling of the room, corridor and lobby is quite contemporary. There is a nice use of colour throughout the hotel and touches of modern materials such as plastic, glass and metal. We had a nice LCD tv with hundreds of channels, security box, and a small fridge with drinks included on the price and replenished everyday. The bathroom in red and green was very clean and well stocked of toiletries and towels although a bit revealing (visually and aurally, if you know what I mean... ) so you better have no secrets with the other guests... The air con was a blessing and worked to perfection during the hot weekend. The noise outside the hotel, however can be an issue if you are hosted in the lower floors, also don't forget to close the shutters as the light may wake you up too soon. The breakfast was also better than I had anticipated, if you don't mind having powder juice and the same stuff three days in a row that is. I used to have a bacon butty, some cheese and cold meats, fruit and yogurt, we missed some eggs to be fair. About the Termini area, the hotel is two minutes from the station and a half an hour stroll from the main turistic atractions. If you like walking you'll be fine, and if you opt for public transport you have tube on the doorstep, many buses lines and an eight euro ride will take you anywhere. Late at night, the area can turn a bit seedy, but apart from a transvestite pinching my friend's nipple on our way back to the hotel and the feeling of somebody following your footsteps, it was all fine... but I wouldn't go on my own late at night. Our rate included being greeted and collected from the airport, wi-fi and also some sort of cocktail that we never had. The staff was nice at reception and at the restaurant so very happy overall. There might be cheaper places in Rome and you may find better value for money or more centric places to stay, but all in all, thumbs up for the Ariston.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, stay at the Ariston”
Reviews.Author: Minnesotaactor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ariston Hotel for 2 nights. Wonderful room on the fourth floor. Location is perfect for getting around where you need to go. Front desk staff very helpful and personable. Yes! this is the place to stay when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Italy for us”
Reviews.Author: Ellik111
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling around Italy for several weeks, and were really hoping to get a nice hotel in Rome, as it was our last destination. This hotel looked very nice at the pictures, so we took it. Well, as my husband said shortly after we came into the room: It is the worst room we have been in the Italy. I agree with him. The room was very small, very small, only a bed and a little TV could be there. There was only a tiny closet, where our clothes could not be in. There are carpets on the floor and textil on the walls, the room was very dark even with open windows. The bathroom was very small too, without a bide (which is normal in Italy). The shower did not work properly, when you want the hot water, the pressure is very little. No place to put your stuff in the bathroom, and one day I was taking a shower, and saw a large beetle on the floor running across the bathroom. No need to say, I was very upset by that!! The staff of the hotel were not specially nice either. There was one guy, that was extremely helpfull, but that's not, others were not.

Reviews.Title: “Super good location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: yundi79
Reviews.Content: The room is good, location is perfect, just one minute to get to termini by walk. The breakfast buffet is good, but the room rate is a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “This is not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Zsoly
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the time of 11 into the hotel in the evening, 1 woman talked with an Italian man on the reception. With what did not say hello we waited, but I asked it after 10 minutes, that possibly check-in? I ordered their best room, but I asked it that let there be a double bed in him, (they did not answer the e-mail of course).The lady knew about the bed, and said it, that executive we have a room. We got the key, we went up we were shocked entering the room then because it is cca. a double bed size was. Back onto the reception, I say it we did not order one like this.Answer: yes but he believed this because of the double bed. I say it gets the other one.We got to it cca. 3x of that size, with two beautiful beds , that is afraid under a minute pushed. Next trouble: the room cold. Le onto the reception: forgot to activate it the room.Ok. We grow in the morning, cca. 18 degrees in the room. I indicate it to the reception again, promise,that it is solved. Na this did not succeed under three days, the repairman said that there is a thermostat vainly in the room, it not in that direction truth, that the guest set, but gives two blankets. This much were the help.Breakfast: not 4 starry ones. Every day the same one: 1 mortadella, 1 salami, 1 cheese, scrambled eggs, bacon. Reception:ca.we met 5 person, from which one an behaved normally, in the others no helpfulness. I cannot recommend it if a service like this is put beside their most expensive room. And very much not liked, that tried to sell the normal room at the most expensive price

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: Please don't make the same mistake I did and stay at this hotel. During our a recent trip to Italy, my husband and I needed a hotel to sleep in for 1 night before our flight back home. Florence was the last city we visited during this trip but we had to go back to Rome the night before, as our flight was leaving from there. As we were going to be in Rome for literally 12 hours only, we thought we'd book a hotel near Termini station. I selected this hotel based on the okay reviews on Tripadvisor. I figured it's 12 hours, we'd be sleeping most of the time, so how bad can it be? Well, very bad indeed. After we checked in, we were showed to our room, a tiny box which had no ventilation whatsover. After unpacking we tried to turn on the heating/aircon and found it was not working. I called the front desk and advised them that there was no ventilation in the room, and that the heating/aircon was not working, and could they please send someone up to take a look at the unit. The woman at the front desk insisted that "it's working" - I assured her it was not - she kept insisting, I kept telling her it wasn't. Finally she relented to sending someone from maintenance to have a look. After fiddling around with the switch for 20 mins., the maintenance guy confirmed that the unit is indeed not working. He said he was going to go into the other room and see if the issue was a switch. Fine. 30 mins later he has not returned. I called the front desk again and asked them where the maintenance guy was, as by this time we were suffocating in the room (opened the room door). She said she was going to look for him, but that she knows that the unit is working. Once again I told her that it was not working and maintenance guy was actually going to find out what the problem was. Anyway, an hour later after much frustration, I got maintenance guy - who eventually came back up to our room - to confirm with his colleague that the unit indeed was not working. He left and we were left there with no ventilation. I called front desk and asked to be moved to another room since we cannot stay in this one. They said they will call me back. About half an hour later they still haven't called back so I called again - this time extremely frustrated - and it was only then that she said fine, we'll change your room. We were then shown to another room, which had a working heating/airconditioning. After we unpacked again, we noticed a really bad sewer smell coming from the bathroom. We checked the bathroom, it was fairly clean but had this horrible sewer smell. At this point it was late in the night, we needed to sleep and so we just decided to keep the bathroom closed the whole night instead of moving again. The bed linens were clean but for some reason had a bad smell to them. The next morning when we had to take showers we noticed that there was no door to the shower!!! It looked like there was one previously but was taken down. So water from the shower got everywhere in the bathroom when you took a shower. Needless to say, our stay at this hotel was an aboslute disaster. I am writing this review so that other people don't make the same mistake I did. I am sure there are other cheap hotels out there with much better service and facilities. Stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - not disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: KezzaKKC
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for a very short break (one night, two days) with my brother and two friends. We had three rooms between us and none of us had any complaints. My room was a good size, with a large shower cubicle and good flow of hot water. Flat screen TV with satellite box. Tea & coffee provided with a kettle and free soft drinks in the mini bar (a nice touch when one remembers that most hotels charge silly money for mini bar items!). I rarely sleep well in strange beds and I have to say that I fell to sleep virtually straight away in my bed. Whilst this may have been a result of all the walking that day, suffice to say the bed was definitely more comfortable than most hotels of its class. I saw one other room and it was larger than mine, but had a smaller bathroom and shower cubicle. My brother's room evidently had a bath with shower over. Check-in was very slow - they don't seem to have a very organised system. Breakfast was fine with a reasonable assortment of cold foods. The coffee was lukewarm and pretty mediocre and, having read another review here AFTER returning, I have to say that there was no evidence of being able to order espresso, capuccino, etc (the hotel bar does not serve coffee at all). The scrambled eggs looked 'strange' and the crispy bacon was very greasy and in tiny pieces. Excellent bread! When all is said and done, I'd definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again. Good value for money (we paid 100 Euro and 110 Euro for two superior doubles and 85 Euro for a standard double. I feel it's worth the extra for the superior rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 10/10”
Reviews.Author: westiefergus76
Reviews.Content: I've just read the two negative posts about this hotel. I think they've got the wrong hotel. We booked this hotel from the reservations booth at the Termini Train station. Less than 1 minutes walk away. We we arrived the receptionist was very friendly, we even received a complimentary drink at the bar. This hotel is the boutique variety. 2 lovely sculptures in the front entrance. The room we stayed in was on the 5 floor, it was the best room during our 10 day visit. We stayed here for 2 days. The room was very clean with a plasma TV/satelite system. Free mini bar, a massive shower it was HUGE. In fact the whole toilet was HUGE!!!. This is a truely fantastic hotel. I would recommend it to anyone. Not the best location but only 2 minutes walk to the metro, then within 2 metro stops your at the spanish steps/or trevi fountain. In fact you could probably walk to them from the hotel. There's a lovely little restaurant directly over the road from the hotel, can't remember the name but food was very nice and cheap. I would visit again. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: Dibbley
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed here as the first part of a multicentre trip, we landed are Rome airport and got the train to the center of Rome (Teminus), don't forget to get your tickets stamped on the station platform, the walk to the hotel from the station was short and uneventful, although the area was extremly lively, the hotel was clean and the staff friendly, the room had no view, but to be honest there were no views to be had anyway. There were free soft drinks in the room and breakfast was good, you do need to ask for speciality coffee's though, Expresso, lates etc. It is a bit of a walk to most of the attractions, although you can get the metro for 1 Euro, we walked everywhere. Overall I was happy to start my holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “Airston perfect for using the train”
Reviews.Author: DesertDarling
Reviews.Content: Ariston was perfect for an overnight before our cruise out of Civitavecchia. We took the train from the airport. The hotel was less than 2 blocks away. The breakfast was wonderful. The room was small, but the TV had the BBC and CNN for watching Olympic coverage. Sorry we did not stay there on our return from the cruise since it is so convenient to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Ariston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: World_explorer_HK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week on the Royal Caribbean cruise and we stayed one night at the Ariston Hotel. The hotel is conveniently located about 3 minutes walk from Roma Termini, the main train station. Once you walked out the train station from via Giolitti exit, you can already see the hotel sign. However, you have to make sure you book a delux room because when I first read about the comments on Tripadvisor, I saw that some visitors had a different kind of room. Remember to check with the reservation before hand to make sure you get one of the designers' room. It cost us EUR149 per night including breakfast. Normally for Rome, you have to pay at least EUR 200 to get anything decent. Also the stars don't really mean anything in Italy. The hotel itself is hip and modern so was the room we stayed in. However, I just had one complaint which is the aircon. Although the reading shows 16, it definitely felt like 25. We have told the hotel about it, so hopefully it will be fixed it by the time you visit this hotel. Continental breakfast was great too. Since we arrived quite late in the evening and suffering from jetlag, we didn't have time to visit the bar which looks really trendy. Given the price of the hotel, I would say this is probably the best value for your money. I am extremely fussy about the hotels I stay at but this hotel definitely fits the bill of cheap and chic. Most of all, it is most convenient if all you want to visit Rome because it is so close to the train and metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the scoop!”
Reviews.Author: JudyG-SilverSpring
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ariston because he had a business meeting that had been scheduled there. Most of the members of the group also stayed there, and here's what I figured out about the wide discrepancies of the reviews: if you get the deluxe rooms, they are chic and modern, and you will probably be happy w/ your experience. Several of us who did not get the deluxe rooms were initially put in dark and depressing rooms, with windows that let in no light because the shutters couldn't be opened and they looked out to an air shaft. Those who asked to be moved were accommodated after the first day. We were moved to a room that faced the street, which was larger, brighter, more cheerful. The rug was stained and outdated, but the bed was comfortable and spacious, the bathroom and rest of the room was clean and kept that way throughout our stay. HOWEVER, there was one couple who had reserved a deluxe room but were given the same rooms as ours. Of course, they did not realize until later that they had not been given a deluxe room. Not clear if this was an issue w/ the on-line booking (I think they booked thru booking.com). So, before you get the key to your room, ask that it have a window facing the street, and know what you paid for. In terms of the meeting space, the room was initially set up incorrectly (again, not clear whose fault that was). The room was on the 6th floor, and leaked during particularly heavy rains. The breakfasts were great, the best we had in Italy. The daytime front desk staff were particularly helpful and warm, made arrangements for dinners, tours, inquired about our experience afterwards. All of the staff we encountered tried their best to be helpful, even if their command of English limited them. The neighborhood is wonderful for convenience in getting around because of how close to the train station it is, but somewhat seedy at night. I felt like I might have been less comfortable staying there if I had been on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeonTheRealOne
Reviews.Content: The truth is that Hotel Ariston (the name is Greek and means perfect) in Rome, is a hotel far from perfect. As a matter of fact it is an overpriced, mediocre, 3 star at best, tourist trap. Don't believe the hotel photos from the Website. We booked a double superior room. The room at which we finally stayed in was refurbished and about 20 square meters small, including WC. The bed and blanket was not clean on arrival. There was no room service, although the rooms had a free of charge mini bar with a couple of drinks in it. The receptionist spoke barely English and responded mostly in Italian. The breakfast was with little variety and just ok. But for 265 euros per night we expected far more!

Reviews.Title: “Ariston Rome. A four star experience!”
Reviews.Author: cabbie37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ARISTON from Easter Monday to Friday 2008. I cannot find any negative comments to make. The staff were all friendly, helpful and polite. We used the reception desk as if it were tourist information and all advice given to us was good. We even booked our taxis here and all the vehicles were prompt, reasonably priced and clean. The breakfast dining room was modern, kept constantly clean and the breakfast selection was excellent. They even provided bacon and eggs for the Brits! And boiling water for tea! Both these items are a rarity in Italian hotels. Our room, 346, was clean, spacious, had a free minibar(soft drinks) and a huge comfortable bed made up as a double as we requested. The hotel is well placed for all the major sights and attractions and we found if you book in advance to be excellent value for money. On our last morning the hotel manager personally asked us if we had enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good in refurbished part”
Reviews.Author: paulmcc77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend late January and had a generally good experience. For starters, if you fly with Ryanair you're likely to get the Shuttle bus (which is pretty quick 30-40 mins) into Termini and the hotel is probably 60 secs away from the far side of the Termini where you get dropped off. The reception area and bar are all modern and the check in process was quick an efficient. On reading the other reviews, we decided to pay an extra 30 per night to stay in one of the newer rooms, which are very modern, possibly a bit small. The bath room has a slide door which some might find intrusive and there is no bath but the room is generally good and bed very comfortable. The biggest issue I had is that when I asked for an iron and board they said they had none in the hotel until the morning, which I found unusual. A comfortable hotel, with good location, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would i use this Hotel again????”
Reviews.Author: scimoon
Reviews.Content: To answer my own question, yes i would. The hotel was in a good location and by that i mean it only took 5 minutes to get to from where we were dropped off at the main train station. Yes there are lots of men hanging around but i never felt unsafe. My husband and i stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights, and as soon as we arrived were made to feel really welcome. We were given a room on the 6th floor, the room was very clean, spacious and warm, the free soft drinks were also a welcome surprize, i did find that the room was a bit dark and the bathroom though big was very tired and didn't have a shower curtain... The problem i found was that the Hotel is in the middle of building work so was noisey. So i would wait until the work was finish to go back, and thats why i have only given it an average rating at this time. By the way the breakfast and staff do this Hotel proud and we have decided that we will go back and will take our children too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: decebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel between 15 and 18 October 2007. The ground floor did create a somewhat different picture of the hotel room we were allocated. I think we may have been in one of the older rooms. It was a little small for our liking, but functional and clean. The free mini bar was a nice touch. The only complaint we had to make was that on our first night the shower waste pipe became blocked and we had a mini flood in the bathroom. This was cleared within minutes of reporting and we had no further issues. ALL the staff were friendly and helpfull. We were asked on our first morning during breakfast if our room was okay and again during our last morning. This does give the impression that the management are taking a pro-active approach to customer service. I have given the hotel an average making as I feel the size of the room let it down somewhat - Im sure if we had been in one of the newer rooms it would have been better. That said, the breakfasts were very good and the environment of the bar very good. Would we stay there again? I think yes, and if asked I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Titus07
Reviews.Content: The Ariston is a clean, modern hotel steps away from the main train station. The breakfast was very good. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that the room was quite small and dark - although very quiet and newly remodeled. The area around the train station is not the best. However, if all you are doing is going back and forth to the hotel from the train station - the route is well lit and safe. Compared to other hotels in Rome of similar quality, it is a good value for the money. (booked through venere.com - an excellent site for hotels in Europe)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: calimotxo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "hotel" for two nights as our last point after a tour throughout different cities in europe before flying back to madrid. The lady in the afternoon shift is awful. I provided her our reservation sheets under two diffenrent names and I do not why she only looked at one and said that only one room was available and not two as we had previously reserved. She was panic and had to call her supervisor to double check and ffinally she took a look at the other reservation. Her english was very poor, She began talking to us in italian and realized after a few minutes that we did not understand what she was saying. Then, the elevator was out of service, they were taken some upgrades on the whole building so we had to use the stairs to take our luggage up to the 5th floor. The breakfast is pretty poor, just a few things to choose from. If you want some crepes you had to pay extra for them. The minibar awful as well, no alcohol at all on it. Rooms are nice but if you are taking a shower the door can not be completly closed so the water spreads out throught the whole room. The only positive thing is the location, Termini Station is just a few steps away from the hotel and there is a nice restaurant right across the street. Advice: do not come back too late in the evening to the hotel, there are not nice people walking around. they keep looking at you very weird, specially if you are acoompanied with women.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: king_dingaling
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over at the Ariston Hotel for 4 nights in July 07 and could not really fault the place. Having read previous reviews before writing this I guess we were quite lucky that we were offered a room on the 5th floor - as this is one of the floors that has been newly renovated. The hotel is practically across the road from the Termini Station for trains (overland and underground) and buses, so getting around Rome and to the airport afterwards was really easy. The hotel is also only about 10 minutes walk from the Colloseum and all the other spectacular sites. Although the rooms are a bit small, they are newly refurbished, clean, ultra modern, and most importantly (when visiting in the middle of summer) air conditioned. Our room had a built-in wardrobe with digital safe (you choose your own code) and a small fridge (with free soft drinks). The bathroom is a decent size, with all new fixtures/fittings. Bedroom is all new with a plasma tv and sky (the italian version). Breakfasts were great with a decent selection of foods - eggs, bacon, toast, cereals, yoghurts, fruit, fresh juice, coffee (basically everything you could want in a breakfast). The best part of the hotel are the staff who were extremely helpful and friendly thoughout our stay. A great bonus was the fact that they kept our bags for us on the last day after check out at 11am, so that we could go site seeing without the hassle of lugging them around with us all day. I would definitely stay with them again. I think it's worth a mention that we went on the trip with another couple who stayed at the Hotel California around the corner. Our room was only 15 Euros a night more than theirs, but they had a nightmare of a time with dodgy rooms and unfriendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “fine city hotel”
Reviews.Author: willy b
Reviews.Content: fine hotel. very good near the termini station. Only 2 minutes by foot. Very clean and comforteble. The staff are very friendly. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: waterrat1
Reviews.Content: The Ariston is in an old building, close to the Termini Train Station. It has been refurbished, leaving some of the lovely old light fixtures and actually having a kind of air conditioning. The bathroom was huge and all marble. Beds very comfortable. There was a plasma television and a refrigerator. The windows have both glass and shutters and can be opened. The multi-lingual desk staff were accommodating and very pleasant and made some reservations for us which turned out perfectly. Breakfast, which is included, was good. We liked the closeness of the hotel to attractions like the Forum and because it was away from the very crowded areas like the Spanish Steps, we noticed that the restaurant prices were much more reasonable. The several we tried in the area were extremely good. Perhaps because we had experienced a really rotten disembarkation from a cruise ship at Cittiavecchia, the hotel seemed like a refuge from the craziness. Nonetheless, I would heartily recommend it as a reasonably-priced (for Rome), welcoming and charming place to stay for those who can live without an American-style modern surroundings. There was both a cash machine and a small grocery store just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: dak76
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, fantastic rooms - very modern, spacious, clean, good price for what you get. Good location to get around (10-15 min walk down via cavour and your in the historic centre of rome). I booked this hotel for my girlfriend's 30th birthday and we were not disappointed even though the hotel is still under renovation on some floors (gym & roof terrace were closed). Would recommend this hotel to anyone, but if your not convinced check out my photos. We are definatly staying here again the next time we're in Rome. 4* hotel, 5*feel.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: asitisWales
Reviews.Content: i took 18 of us for a long weekend,to watch the rugby in march.to a man we all thought we had value for our money.the rooms were fine in fact better than we had thought they would be, after reading a lot of reviews on this site. the staff are great in the hotel,with a good breakfast on top. i think a lot of the people who have reviewed this hotel .have champagne taste on beer money!

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: lounewry
Reviews.Content: I have not even had the chance to stay as they tried to rip us off before we even got there. A party of 10 of us, 5 couples, booked and me and my partner were told first of all that we could not stay and then the hotel got back in touch to say that we could stay but to rebook on their website but didnt mention that they had put the price up by 200euro in the meantime. I think it is ridiculous and would certainly not recommend styaing there. We have never experienced this before

Reviews.Title: “Chic Ariston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidMooney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ariston hotel and really enjoyed it. We were put in the new modernised rooms which were excellent, functional and clean. In our party of 13 people everyone liked it,especially the bathrooms.. The hotel is in a good central location without too much noise. Breakfast in the hotel was good with a large selection of foods. Another good point is the lively hotel bar and at 4 euros for a large beer it is really good value. Overall great value for money and this hotel should be checked out if thinking about a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: TourIreland
Reviews.Content: A friend and myself stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in early March 2007. I booked this hotel a couple of months in advance having read a number of positive reviews. I had seen warnings that the hotel was under renovation and to request a room on the 5th or 6th floor (the recently renovated section) which I did and was assured my room "would be as appears on our website". We flew into Ciampino Airport and decided to use the Shuttlebus service which brings you to Stazione Termini near the centre of Rome for a very reasonable 8 euro each. Comfortable and spacious, we did not have to wait to long for departure and were able to enjoy a view of the Roman outskirts on our way in. Hotel Ariston is located on Via Filippo Turati, a mere 5 minute stroll from the Stazione Termini. This is great as it means not only are you close to some major local attractions (the Fora, Colleseum, etc. are all within walking distance) but for those trips a little further afield (or when you're just too tired to walk!) you are conveniently located near the main bus terminus and train station. On arrival, we were greeted by an English-speaking receptionist who booked us in and took our passports (a firsty in my travels - experience to date involves a photocopy taken of the passport or swipe of the credit card but our passports were retained for the duration of our stay). As requested, we had a room on the renovated 5th floor. First impression was "small" but once the luggage was packed away and we'd settled in it was more than adequate. There were two very comfortable double beds with plenty of pillows, a table and some very modern "arty"-type chairs. The room was air-conditioned but nothing beats a bit of fresh air - our double windows opened onto the front of the hotel which did not afford amazing views and when open let in a lot of noise (but Rome is a very noisy city and I'm not sure if any centrally-located hotel can avoid this problem). In terms of in-room facilities, there was a safe (quite reassuring if you're carrying large amounts of cash), a small refridgerator (complimentary soft-drinks and water restocked everyday), a kettle and small selection of herbal tea, and a large flat-screen TV with nly 1 or 2 English-speakinhg channels (although on the last day of our stay a Sky satellite box was installed in the room). If the bedroom was cosy, the bathroom was spacious. Very modern and comfortable, the "arty" feel is taken to a new level here with see-through glass doors to both the bathroom and shower. This was a little off putting as it reduced privacy quite a bit! The hotel bar is comfortable and ideal for chilling out after a long day of sight-seeing. A very limited selection of beer is available and quite to my own disappointment the largest volume a Guinness comes in is 330mls! So much for a pint of the black stuff! There is a range of wine also. Prices were reasonable enough and the service prompt. The dining room opens only for breakfast, served between 7 - 10.30 am. A large selection of food is available. Cereal, bread, cheese, smoked ham, scrambled eggs and bacon, fruit salad, yoghurts, pastries, juices and teas (fond of herbal teas I was delighted with the huge range available!). The best part is breakfast is included in the price of your stay and is buffet-style so you help yourself and can take as much as you like. Ideal for filling up before a long day of touring the city. There is also a roof garden which has seen better days although some work was being carried out on it during our stay. The hotel seems to be still undergoing renovation and improvement (as mentioned, the installation of the satellite box during our stay). The one negative impact this had on us was the like-clockwork noise at 6am every morning as work on the building began. The noise above our room could be likened to that in a bowling alley. That said, by day 2 it had been referred to as the "wake-up call" and quickly became this - Rome is best travelled early in the morning before the hordes venture out. All-in-all, a very pleasant stay in a comfortable and reasonably priced hotel. There were no hidden extras - we payed what we expected - and if at times it was a little noisy or untidy, I could forgive it as it was all in the sake of improvement. ne final piece of advice which has nothing to do with the hotel but may help first-time visitors to Rome: be cautious with some restaurants as there are often "hidden" prices included. We found out the hard way that most places charge you a couple of euro for bread, water and table service before you've even ordered anything! And one place that really left us with a bad taste in our mouths charged us 7 euro for a plate of chips (and this was no fancy 5-star diner!). So read the menus and feel free to decline water or bread if you're not interested. That said, the place just across from the hotel is a good spot for nice food, fast service and low cost. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ariston - a let down”
Reviews.Author: foodie_tourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel which was rated 4-star on a booking site. It is really more like a 3-star. Other than the location, the hotel is a total letdown. Beware of the hotel description which suggest that it may have been renovated recently. This is unture and the pictures are totally mismatching what we got. The rooms are really tiny - our double room only have a foot width on both sides of the bed and 2 feet at the end of the bed. The bathrooms are decent and clean but again very small. The shower area is so small one can hardly move. For the price we paid, we immediately found better choices the next day in the same neighbourhood. The breakfast is not too impressive either.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: travelpassion
Reviews.Content: I organised a Battlefield Tour to Italy for 60 people and after visiting all of the hotels in the Termini area, I booked the Ariston due to the cost and availability. I had been a bit worried given the negative comments the hotel receives on Trip Advisor but it worked out fine for our large group and I received no complaints. It is true that only certain floors have been refurbished but just make sure you stipulate a refurbished room on your request. The breakfast was very good with a reasonable choice of hot and cold foods from the buffet. The bar is funky and sociable and the hotel is ideally located within 5 mins of Termini Station, the Metro and the Terravision bus to Ciampino Airport. Sure there are drunks, druggies, etc around the station but they are not threatening and do not bother you. The Ariston is fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “ok for business or uncomplicated folks, good location”
Reviews.Author: MAETZLI
Reviews.Content: I stood at the Ariston with a group of friends ( male) for two nights in early November 2006. The Hotel is clean and comfortable, though the single rooms are TINY. ( A single bed, wardrobe, desk, flat TV screen, toilet and shower on probably 12 square meters.) But, who cares. Rome is so interesting that I just spent some hours in the hotel for sleeping. If you are in Rome for business or if you don't spend too much time in the hotel, the place is ok, but never a 4-**** hotel, probably 3 would fit. The location is great, only a 3 minutes walk away from Termini station, which is perfect for the use of public transport. The breakfast service is very good and worth being booked. Different breads, fruit sald, cheese, ham, scrumbled eggs, fresh orange juice ( you press it yourself). That was very good. Opposite the hotel, there is a relatively good trattoria for cheap but good pasta and pizza, good wine ( Barbera) and very good beer and english speaking staff. Book the hotel through the internet and do not pay the official price, which is 190 Euro for a single room. I got the room for EUR 108 ( breakfast included), which is fair. (Rome IS expensive)

Reviews.Title: “WOW! The Hotel Ariston - We hope to return”
Reviews.Author: davetrig
Reviews.Content: My first time in Rome. Six of us (three couples, each comprising a former police officer) stayed six nights at the Hotel Ariston near the rail "Termini". One couple visit often and recommended the Ariston. It's convenient for connections though not so central to the main sights - if you don't mind walking or are prepared to risk the public transport it's fine. Risk it most certainly is - two out of six of us were pickpocketed on consecutive days, me getting onto the Metro and my brother-in-law on the bus! That kind of street crime is rife. And we were aware and cautious, but they were very skilled, daring and discerning. Tip: if you suspect someone is "eyeing" you up as a prospect make eye contact for long enough to register their description. Perhaps we were unusually fortunate being allocated fifth floor rooms at the Ariston - recently refurbished and very much to my taste. A spacious, contemporary and uncluttered feel with superb shower room, all mod cons and fantastic mood lighting. Our first reaction really was "WOW"! The lift was small and much in demand and the stairs were uncomfortably narrow. One level was obviously undergoing refurbishment as floor finishes were missing there but at least the task is in hand. We only ate breakfast at the hotel. There was plenty of choice from a comprehensive and well stocked buffet but there was the occasional delay in being seated at peak times. The staff were courteous, efficient and welcoming though there was some justified grumbling about the mini-bars not being restocked on a daily basis and smiles from the reception staff were somewhat lacking. The general manager(?) was a charming but firm man doing his best to keep staff on their toes. We ate out most evenings at the very good "Tudini" restaurant immediately across the street. Within a whisker of an "excellent rating" (but for the refurbishment work and missing smiles) - well done though Ariston and thank you! We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: moollooo
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 2 separate occassions for a night each. The 1st night, we got room 120, which seems to be the only one on that level without renovation. Floor was not carpetted and toilet looks like it need some renovation. For the 2nd occassion, we arrived at the hotel at close to 1400 which is the check in time, and were told that we had to wait for an hour before the room was ready. Staff was uninterested in getting us the room promptly and they were unapologetic about letting us wait indefinitely. Room seems to have gone through some renovation and was reasonably ok compared to the first time. Only redeeming points were the complimentary cold beverages in the mini bar and the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NNC0
Reviews.Content: We're kind of low budget folk and got a room at the Ariston for the night of July 08. It was a wonderful stay. I can't believe some of the negative reviews because in my opinion the staff were the most professional and courteous in all of the hotels we used in Italy. The accomodations were far beyond what we had at more expensive places and the breakfast was done first rate with ample selection and choice. Absolutely it was the nicest hotel we stayed in. The location is excellent as well. Essentially a block away from the Termini station, access to the airport train, the subway, and the busses, very impotant if you plan to stay out past 111:30 pm, is excellent. My only negative comment would be that being on the 3 rd flr, I couldn't find my way to the lobby using the staircase and had to use the elevator. Perhaps somebody else can advise on that. All in all,for the price and 30 euro more, the Ariston delivered what in my opinion is probably the best value I've ever received in a Euro hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel From Hell Part Two”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked tyhe Ariston Hotel because the Hotel Morgana, where we had a wonderful stay, was full on our return leg to Rome from Florence for our last few days in Italy prior to heading home to Manila. From accross the street, it seemed at least not far in terms of appointments from the Hotel Morgana, with one extra star to boot. Plus, it prominently advertised that it was a wi-fi hotspot, which meant we had wireless internet access from the rooms. We were all upbeat upon checking in since we had just come from a rustic tuscan-villa experience which was romantic and old-world to say the least, but we were already yearning for some modern day conveniences already. Little did we know what was in store for us. The lady at the front desk when we were checking in must have thought she was god's gift to humanity. Never have I encountered such rudeness and lack of respect in any other place, regardless of country. If I were not a devout catholic then I probably would've ended up in a jail cell that night for assault and battery. And then the bellhop...he was complaining about how our bags made his hands red, even after a thirty euro tip! Is a thirty euro tip not enough? Imagine the nerve of that guy. And then we were told that the airconditioning was out for the whole building but would be fixed in the morning. Morning came and still no airconditioning. We had to fight with the same rude people at the front desk to get one of the three rooms we booked airconditioned. We were too tired fom almost a month of travel around europe to fight anymore. At least, it was the only hotel we stayed in that offered a hot breakfast (as opposed to just cold cuts and bread in most other hotels) as part of the buffet spread.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars - Not By Any Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very disappointing to say the least. The carpets were stained black from traffic. The bathroom was covered with mildew. The bedspread was stained. The room was much smaller than photos I saw prior to booking. The hotel is 2 blocks from Termini, which is a rather seedy part of Rome. I was fortunate that this was a one night stop over on my way to the airport. I have nothing positive to say about Ariston. I stayed in mostly 3 star hotels throughout Italy and thought I would treat myself on the last night in Italy by staying in a more expensive four star hotel. What a waste of money, in that the 3 stars were much nicer and cleaner than Ariston.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and were not impressed. AC worked fine and the beds were ok, but the room was very small (probably originally a single), the safety box didn't work, the "small" toilet flush didn't work, the bathroom sink took forever to empty, the bathroom door could be opened/closed with violence only and the walls had dirty fingerprints all over. When we arrived there was clothing (forgotten) in a drawer and a half-eaten chocolate stick in the minibar. The telephone outside the room would ring often at all hours and nobody ever replied. Carpets and walls were worn and dirty. The bartender preferred watching TV in a back room (you could hear), spoke Italian only and rarely had any change. Breakfast was so-so with boiled rather than fried bacon and coloured sugar-water instead of juice. The yoghurt was nice though. Supposedly a four star hotel with an official double room rate at € 230 (I think). It should be two stars and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ariston and all hotels in the Termini area ----!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely disappointing. After having read a number of reviews, it seems that one’s personal experience in relation to other hotels greatly shapes their opinion. We stayed at the Visconti Palace and Jolly Villa Carpegna, which were not as centrally located, but infinitely better in terms of service, value and room quality. Here’s why: Our room was ridiculously small and the AC didn’t work, a common problem based on the other reviews I’ve read (and a major headache if it’s at all hot outside). We had reserved a double bed and after calling the front desk on it, they were aware a mistake had been made; they just didn’t tell us about it until we complained!!! We instead received a room with a single bed and a cot. The bathroom was adequate. There’s obviously a huge discrepancy in room size, common throughout older hotels in Italy. No joke, our bathroom was just slightly smaller than our room. Breakfast was inadequate and lacked imagination, again common throughout the hotels we stayed at in Italy. Despite the prior complaints (with the exception of no AC) this would all have been tolerable given the price. However my and my wife’s main complaint regards the staff. I can only speak as an American/Canadian and I realize that several nationalities are represented, but.....There is no service with a smile at Hotel Ariston (with the exception of the breakfast staff, which was helpful and prompt). In fact, if you are from the US or Canada, don’t expect anything close to what we are used to anywhere in Italy. Things may get done, they may not, and never expediently. And if you do ask for something, be prepared to feel as if you are annoying them. The world is filled with antipatici/--- and in Italy they seem to be concentrated in the service industry. I can speak frankly about this because I speak Italian, yet feigned ignorance to hear what loose lips will utter. I won’t get into specifics but let me say there’s a lot of poking fun and talking behind people’s backs. The point is this: when you spend your --- hard earned money, which they are only happy to take, you don’t need or want any attitude from anyone except for ‘yes sir’ and ‘right away sir’. That’s it. If somebody wants to compare, stay at a hotel in Las Vegas or any major US or Canadian city and see what service is. Needless to say, we felt ripped off. I could expound further, but I think I got my point across. My advice: don’t stay anywhere in this area near the Termini because it is, essentially, a tourist trap with crappy, overpriced restaurants. If money is not an issue, stay in more modern hotels that have more uniformity in terms of room size and spaciousness. If money is an issue, I guess you could chance it or stay at a hostel where you don’t expect service. Hopefully this helps and as a statement of my integrity you’ll notice I did include my e-mail (no option to leave a name) as most spineless people do.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed!”
Reviews.Author: ashleybga
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ariston was in a very central location - two blocks from the train station. That being said, there was very little else positive to say about this hotel. When we arrived, the staff seemed annoyed to stop what they were doing to even check us in. The walls were paper thin...we could hear the staff shouting at all hours of the day and night. The only positive aspect of Delta Airlines losing our luggage was that there would have been NO where to even put our bags in the miniscule rooms! The bathroom was almost the same size as the rest of the hotel room. One positive - the shower had HOT water (quite a switch from other hotels we've stayed in). The common areas seemed very nice...but our room was dirty beyond belief. Talk about wearing your "shower shoes" 24/7! We were scheduled to stay at the Hotel Ariston on our way back through Rome three weeks later but promptly cancelled our reservation. We couldn't stand another overpriced night in this underwhelming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, but rooms a tad small and dark.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed somewhere to stay in Rome for a couple of days prior to flying home. The Ariston turned out to be a good choice. It's a tastefully decorated place, very close to the Termini station. The room was definately a case of form over function though - the mood lighting wasn't really bright enough, and the glass shower stall managed to leak water all over the bathroom floor, the toilet was just that little bit too close to the wall and so on. The biggest omission was a writing desk of some type - there wasn't really anywhere to empty your pockets, or write a travel diary. It was a bit small too - we had two bags, and managed to keep tripping over them. That said, noise wasn't a problem (double glazing + shutters). You could hear the street below, but it wasn't intrusive. Air conditioning was included in the price, but it took a while to take the heat out of the room. The included breakfast was the best we had at any hotel in Italy. Mostly a European style buffet (breads, cheeses, croissants, cereals, fruit and so on), they had bacon and eggs too if you felt like something hot. The best thing about this hotel were it's staff. As our flight was too early for the airport train we asked if they could arrange a shuttle for us. They offered to box up some breakfast for us to eat on the way! We ended up with a Mercedes, leather seats and driver for about €10 more than our two-year old guidebook said a taxi should cost. A nice way to end the holiday. The area around the hotel is a bit rough around the edges, but it's not a ghetto or anything. The restaurants in the immediate vacinity aren't much (too touristy), but we did enjoy Leonetti's, a couple of blocks further back from the Termini, and to the right. You're not exactly going to be walking out of the hotel and into the major sights. The Colesseum is around 20 minutes away, and would be the closest of the majors to the hotel. Still, the metro and buses are close by at Termini if you don't feel like walking. At €170/night through an online booking service I can't say it's great value, but for Rome in May it's probably about as good as you're going to find. The size of the room would put me off staying here for any great length of time though.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my two children in Feb 2005 and couldn't fault the place. We arrived late in the evening with a dodgy booking (Octupus messed up) tired and fed up. We were greeted by friendly staff who offered us a room anyway and sorted out Octopus in the morning - with no hassle from me. Our room was lovely, one big one with a huge double bed and a small single one, each with a TV, two rooms really, and one bathroom with bidet, spa bath & all the trappings of cosy thick clean towels, shampoo etc. The sheets were crispy clean & white cotton as were the towels all spotlessly clean. It was lovely and warm as it was chilly outside. Breakfast was a lovely buffet of everything you could think of, eggs, sausages, bacon, cereals, pasties, yoghurt, fruits, juices, coffee, loads of things. I found the staff really cheerful and pleasant, I felt really cossetted and cared for. I know some people have reservations about the area but we found it ok, but I guess we didn't go out far late, although we were back after dark and did eat at all of the three restaraunts across the road - each was nice and good value. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome now, at only 125 euros a night, it's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “V. small rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception was good and the staff friendly and helpful. The entrance hall and small lounge area are tastefully decorated. However, the hotel was overheated and the rooms small. Breakfast was second rate. The situation of the hotel, near the railway and bus stations, is the main attraction. I would not rush to recommend the hotel to friends or family. I would not rate this a 4 star hotel, more 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis by Termini”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My last stop in Italy was Florence, but I was flying through Fiumicino so I stayed the last night in Rome. I chose Ariston because it is right near the train station and it would be easy to get there coming from Florence in the afternoon and then taking the Leonardo Express to the airport in the morning. I did not have high hopes because the area around the station is quite seedy. Well, Ariston is an oasis in the desert of gross looking hotels around Termini. Just from the front door you can see that it is not a worn out, smelly place. The lobby is spacious and nicely decorated, and the room was very nice looking, clean, and had no smoke smell (I was concerned because I had not requested a non-smoking room, not realizing how essential this is in Italy). Desk staff was friendly, and it really is a block from the station. Exit Termini where the taxi stand is, go straight one block, make a left, and it's right there. I had no trouble wrestling my wheeled-but-still-heavy bag to and from the station. Because the area is not great (though not dangerous, I don't think), I don't know if you'd want this to be your home base for a visit to Rome, although you can catch any bus and the metro at the station so in that sense it's an easy location to start from. But if you are in my situation of wanting to be near the station for ease of getting to the airport, this is an excellent choice. The price on the room door was E170, I paid E100. I don't know if I'd pay E170 but only because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ariston was an excellent hotel for the money! The staff was incredibly friendly and always went above and beyond. The lounge was a great place to relax after long hot walks in Rome! The breakfast was more than I expected. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were nice & had good showers (though we did run out of hot water one day). The only drawback I can think of is the lighting in the rooms could use a little improvement. Also, I would request a room not facing the street to reduce noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ariston Hotel from 6-9th Sept and found it to be very good value. The rooms were clean, of average size and the air conditioning was more than adequate after a heavy day of sightseeing! The location could not be faulted. It was close to Termini station, walking distance to all the sites and if you didnt feel like walking, 5 mins to the metro at Termini. We did have some qualms about the safeness of the area but we found it to be friendly and not at all threatening. We wouldnt hesitate to recommend the Ariston. It's excellent value for money, we booked through Venere.com and paid 240 Euros for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ariston - Good value.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and recommend the Hotel Ariston. The front desk staff (spoke English) was very helpful, professional and friendly. The public rooms were nice, although the roof garden was closed due to renovation in the hotel. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet, although the wall coverings etc. were dark. The only negative was the stained carpet. "American" breakfast included the usual plus scrambled eggs and meat, lots of choices - cereal, yogurt, canned fruit, cappucino machine, etc. Price and value was good )as I booked way ahead on the internet) - particularly considering how expensive Rome is right now. Location was convenient and near train station. Seems safe enough, but watch out for pickpockets on the trains and metro - major problem in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “what air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ariston from July 31st to Aug 3rd. For the duration of our stay the air conditioning was broken. I wasn't informed until I asked and all I kept hearing was that it would not be repaired until Monday but still was broken when leaving on Wednesday ( eventhough it was 40 degrees celcius outside) . I was also offered a 50% discount when i complained but when i went to settle the bill only recieved a discount of 10 euros a night. I will never stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Roma”
Reviews.Author: mr_terryCanada
Reviews.Content: I can't belive this was only 80 euros. Clean rooms with great A/C. Huge breakfast, we're not talking a few rolls here, there was eggs, bacon sausage, etc. and some fantastic coffee. Two minutes from Termini station. Rooms were BIG by European standards. Have a Chianti or two in the hotel bar. The bartender was great. Overall, the hotel was great. We'd stay here again in a second.
